SO good, that I visited 3 times in a single week! This is a casual spot in the El Raval neighborhood that locals as well as "in the know" tourists frequent.  Everything on the menu that we had was delicious, and you can choose from tapas or a larger size portion (ration).  We tried the pulpo (octopus), razor clams, mussels, the tomato bread, clams in green sauce, snails.  And the wine selection...don't get me started!  An amazing bottle of Rioja for 9 Euros...makes you feel like a jerk for paying $40 for a bottle of wine in NY! The service was excellent and they spoke English well enough to get the job done!  Absolutely worth the visit :-)
